author: Javier Oca√±a
title: ‚ÄòEl cuervo‚Äô: treinta a√±os despu√©s de la muerte de Brandon Lee, llega una resurrecci√≥n m√°s violenta | Cultura | EL PA√çS
text: Las pel√≠culas benditas son sencillas de vender: son magn√≠ficas, y punto. Por desgracia, las malditas tambi√©n son de f√°cil venta: c√≥mo no hablar de una obra (e incluso ir a verla) que acab√≥ con la vida de su protagonista a mitad de rodaje por el mal disparo de una bala real que no deb√≠a estar all√≠, y m√°s a√∫n si ese actor era hijo de un mito. Que se lo digan a Brandon Lee , hijo de Bruce, muerto a los 28 a√±os en estas circunstancias durante la filmaci√≥n de El cuervo (1994), de Alex Proyas . O que se lo digan, sin ir m√°s lejos, a Alec Baldwin y a su w√©stern maldito Rust. Con El cuervo, nueva versi√≥n de los c√≥mics de James O‚ÄôBarr, ha ocurrido algo curioso en los √∫ltimos tiempos: como ha tardado la friolera de 15 a√±os en producirse desde que se iniciaron los trabajos, tambi√©n se ha vendido en algunos medios como una peculiar extensi√≥n de su malsana leyenda. En esta d√©cada y media han pasado por ella varios directores, guionistas e int√©rpretes (entre ellos, Stephen Norrington y los cineastas espa√±oles Juan Carlos Fresnadillo y Francisco Javier Guti√©rrez, adem√°s de los actores Luke Evans y Jason Momoa), pero nada m√°s lejos que una nueva mano negra; simplemente el peliagudo proceso que a veces tienen ciertas superproducciones, aunque parezca evidente que en su rodaje se lo hayan tomado en serio y adoptado medidas extremas para evitar accidentes, como usar pistolas falsas, algo extra√±o en las producciones de EE UU. Ahora, claro, hay que venderla. Y el camino m√°s corto es algo as√≠ como ‚Äúla nueva versi√≥n de aquella pel√≠cula que acab√≥ con la vida de Brandon Lee‚Äù. Sin embargo, ah√≠ tambi√©n yerran, porque esto de Sanders no es un remake sino una relectura con no pocos cambios internos, aunque la base sea la misma: el estado entre la vida y las sombras de un joven asesinado junto a su novia, que regresa de entre los muertos para vengarse de los culpables. Y, sobre todo, con una estructura completamente diferente de la pel√≠cula de Proyas, y un tono bastante menos negro, mucho m√°s violento y, si se quiere, realista. Treinta a√±os despu√©s de la mirada g√≥tica de Proyas, director de la excelente Dark City (1998), cuya carrera se fue diluyendo tras la entretenida Yo, robot (2004), Sanders toma el testigo con una obra menos juvenil (‚Äú¬øQui√©n demonios se casa en Halloween?‚Äù, dec√≠a uno de los criminales antes de asesinar a la pareja el d√≠a de antes de su boda), no apta para todos los p√∫blicos (no lleven a los ni√±os, esto no es Marvel), que encuentra precisamente en la violencia desaforada y la puesta en escena de esta su mejor fuente de energ√≠a, y casi √∫nica. Como su hermano Alexander, Bill Skarsg√•rd , otro m√°s de los hijos de Stellan, gran actor dan√©s, tiene un rostro inquietante y una mirada esquiva con inmensas posibilidades, pero es dif√≠cil encontrarle la gracia cinematogr√°fica (interpretativa y fotog√©nica) a la cantante brit√°nica FKA Twigs. Y en lo narrativo y visual, pese a un par de im√°genes con cierta potencia, la primera mitad, previa a las muertes que en la versi√≥n de Proyas ocurr√≠an a los cinco minutos, ambientada en buena parte en una especie de sanatorio dist√≥pico para j√≥venes con adicciones, mitad c√°rcel, mitad cuartel militar, y donde se conocen las dos ‚Äúalmas gemelas‚Äù de la historia, est√° cerca del tost√≥n. Ahora bien, tras la escenificaci√≥n de la matanza, dotada de unos primeros planos sobrecogedores, este nuevo cuervo se recupera gracias a la coreograf√≠a de un par de notables secuencias de acci√≥n (una en el interior de un coche; otra en el cl√≠max final en la √≥pera), y podr√≠a encontrar su p√∫blico entre los fan√°ticos de la explicitud: degollamientos, desmembramientos, cuellos rotos en primer plano y sangre salpicando por doquier. Al menos esta parte levanta el vuelo, y adem√°s culmina con un bonito final. ¬øPor qu√© est√°s viendo esto?

author: tomas.watkins@bgfg.co.uk (Tomas Watkins)
title: Amazon deal slashes price of popular Samsung curved monitor
text:
SAMSUNG 27‚Ä≥ CF39 Series FHD 1080p Curved Computer Monitor
Amazon deal slashes price of popular Samsung curved monitor
This Samsung monitor was just discounted on Amazon.
WePC is reader-supported. When you buy through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Prices subject to change.
Learn more
Guess what we found on Amazon this January? An awesome deal on a stunning
PC monitor out there, and it‚Äôs friendly on the wallet. The Samsung 27‚Ä≥ CF39 Curved Monitor, applauded with an impressive 4.6-star rating based on over 25,000 reviews, is currently enjoying a substantial 27% discount. Renowned for its versatility, it‚Äôs an ideal choice for your everyday tasks.
This ultraslim 1080p
curved monitor is up for grabs at just $159.99, marking a notable $60 off from its original price of $219.99.
What do we like about this Samsung curved monitor deal?
- Curved Display: The dramatic 1800R curvature matches the natural field of view for increased engagement across the 27-inch screen.
- Ultra Thin Design: Measuring less than an inch, the slim, circular base and trim bezels complement minimalist workstations in style.
- Gaming Experience: Its AMD FreeSync support smooths gameplay while fast 4ms response times keep action crisp in movies and shooters alike.
- Extensive Viewing Comfort: TUV Rheinland certification verifies effective eye fatigue reduction for extended general use far beyond gaming.
- Crystal Color: The 3000:1 contrast ratio pumps color brilliance balanced with deep blacks, revealing subtle detail amid vivid images.
- Eco-Friendly Efficiency: Its auto-brightness adjustment intelligently saves power whenever possible for a reduced consumption footprint.
Should you invest in this Samsung curved monitor deal?
This 27-inch Samsung curved monitor brings an immersive viewing experience to desktop entertainment and gaming at an affordable price point. The gently wrapped 1080p screen with 1800R curvature expands your field of view for engrossing video and gameplay visuals. Fast on-screen motion looks fairly fluid as well, thanks to a speedy 4 ms response time and adaptive FreeSync technology. The display produces vibrant colors and contrast too, while an Eye Saver mode prevents strain during longer viewing periods. Connectivity is a bit limited, but the slim, modern aesthetics add style to your space. For the price of $159.99, it provides a surprisingly engaging front-row-like viewing experience.

author: Mbali Tebele
title: An Old Video of Mbongeni Ngema Blasting ANC Resurfaces on Social Media - Briefly.co.za
text: An Old Video of Mbongeni Ngema Blasting ANC Resurfaces on Social Media - An old clip of the late Mbongeni Ngema resurfaced on social media - The icon is seen on the video shared online, ranting about how the ANC has turned against its people - The star is also heard saying that they are a lost cause and won't be swayed to do the right thing Many [South Africans](https://briefly.co.za/19146-list-famous-south-africans.html) are [mourning the death of a legend](https://briefly.co.za/entertainment/celebrities/176388-lebo-m-mourns-safarina-star-mbongeni-ngemas-untimely-death-touching-post/) and an icon. The late veteran Mbongeni Ngema's old memories have been shared online. Video of Mbongeni bashing the ANC resurfaces The 68-year-old [Sarafina! creator passed away](https://briefly.co.za/entertainment/celebrities/176379-mbongeni-ngema-dies-head-collision-accident-a-funeral-eastern-cape/) on Wednesday, 27 December 2023, in a head-on collision, and after the news of his death was confirmed, many netizens poured in their tributes and condolences. Recently [old clips of the star](https://briefly.co.za/entertainment/celebrities/176392-old-video-mbongeni-ngema-discussing-sarafina-resurfaces/) have resurfaced and shared on social media, and one of those clips was of him bashing the now ANC. In the video, Ngema is heard saying that the political party has turned its back on their [people](https://briefly.co.za/people/) and they could not be swayed to do the right thing for their people. The [@ZANewsFlash](https://twitter.com/ZANewsFlash) posted the clip and wrote: "WATCH: The late Mbongeni Ngema once had this to say about the current ANC. He said "they have turned against their people" and added that they are like a lost cause. They could not be swayed to do the right thing for the people." See the [post](https://twitter.com/zanewsflash/status/1740301708046057752?s=46&t=BX6HfVuaRHZugGlL_Tkaew) below: SA responds to the post See some of the responses below: @SeanDelchaye wrote: "Says the same man who once pocketed 14mil for Sarafina 2 to be a aids awareness musical and it never came to light." @KingNkosana_ said: "They'll insult you those ones." @bigkoostar mentioned: "I argue that there was never any stage where the ANC was for the people.The ANC has always been against their people." @nhlangu1 responded: "This guy is the reason we have Lady Smith Black Mambazo. His journey to Philadelphia & back to Lamontville & meeting with OR Tambo to make it Possible for Amambazo." @diplomatl wrote: "He wasn‚Äôt wrong. May His Revolutionary Soul Rest In Power." @FreeGeneraxion mentioned: "Anyone who pretend to want to revive the anc is the enemy of the people." Minister Zizi Kodwa reacts to Dr Mbongeni Ngema's death In more [entertainment](https://briefly.co.za/entertainment/) news, Briefly News reported South Africa's Minister of Sports, Arts and Culture, Zizi Kodwa, has taken to social media to [mourn Mbongeni Ngema's untimely death](https://briefly.co.za/entertainment/celebrities/176385-minister-zizi-kodwa-reacts-dr-mbongeni-ngemas-death-sas-great-playwrights/). The SA entertainment industry has suffered another great loss days after singer Bulelwa "Zahara" Mkutukana's death. Mbongeni Ngema's untimely death has left the industry and fans reeling. PAY ATTENTION: –°heck out news that is picked exactly for YOU - click on [‚ÄúRecommended for you‚Äù](https://briefly.co.za/recommended/) and enjoy! Source: Briefly News

author: Kyle Jones
title: Woman arrested for OWI, asks Madison police to care for pet guinea pig while in jail | News | channel3000.com
text: MADISON, Wis. -- Madison police officers were given an unexpected job following an arrest downtown Monday afternoon. Officers were called to the 1200 block of East Washington Ave. at around 3:40 p.m. after a 44-year-old woman allegedly crashed her vehicle into multiple parked cars.

organizations.name: save tags owi guinea pig pet madison kyle jones digital

author: Larry Ramer
title: Economic Outlook 2024: Bright Prospects With One Looming Storm Cloud | InvestorPlace
text: Recently released data indicates the labor market remains strong. Meanwhile, a recent statement by a Federal Reserve president left me more convinced than ever that the central bank plans to cut interest rates multiple times in 2024. All of these developments are very positive for the economic outlook in the new year. Also boding well for the economy and stocks is Goldman Sachs‚Äô (NYSE: [GS](https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/gs-stock-quote/)) belief the global economy will be stronger than many expect this year. However, on the negative side, at least one analyst agrees with my contention that U.S. housing prices will likely fall significantly in 2024. Still, I believe the overall outlook for the U.S. economy and American stocks remains upbeat. The Labor Market and the Economy Are Still Strong In November, the economy [added an impressive total](https://nypost.com/2023/12/28/business/new-us-jobless-claims-rise-again-as-labor-market-cools/) of 199,000 positions, way up from the 150,000 net jobs gained in October. What‚Äôs more, the unemployment rate dropped to 3.7% in November from 3.9% the previous month. With the unemployment rate down, it‚Äôs clear the labor market is still generally strong. As a result, the chances of a recession occurring in 2024 are quite low. Also making a recession unlikely, are two other developments pointed out by Fundstrat analyst Tom Lee, who famously [made a great, bullish](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/wall-street-bull-gives-highest-2024-sp-forecast-yet-192122201.html) and accurate call about the stock market at the beginning of 2023 in the face of so much pessimism. Specifically, Lee is [now noting](https://twitter.com/JuliaLaRoche/status/1741104872299139234) that [purchasing managers‚Äô indexes ](https://www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence/en/mi/products/pmi-faq.html#:~:text=The%20Purchasing%20Managers'%20Index%E2%84%A2,inventories%20of%20both%20inputs%20and)‚Äúare bottoming. That leads to a cyclical earnings recovery.‚Äù Moreover, he pointed out that last quarter, excluding energy companies, the earnings of S&P 500 firms jumped 10% versus the same period a year earlier. Finally, Goldman Sachs in November [predicted the](https://www.goldmansachs.com/intelligence/pages/the-global-economy-will-perform-better-than-many-expect-in-2024.html) global economy would grow more rapidly ‚Äúthan many expect in 2024,‚Äù with a manufacturing comeback and interest rate cuts providing positive catalysts. The Fed Is Definitely Ready to Cut Rates On Dec. 18, San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly provided the strongest indication yet that the central bank is preparing to cut rates next year. Specifically, Daly [noted she expects](https://www.wsj.com/economy/central-banking/fed-official-says-rate-cuts-could-be-needed-next-year-to-prevent-over-tightening-29d009ce) the Fed to cut rates around ‚Äúthree times‚Äù in 2024, and stated ‚Äúrate cuts would be appropriate to prevent inflation-adjusted or ‚Äòreal‚Äô rates from rising.‚Äù The Fed president also emphasized the central bank must begin worrying more about unemployment going forward. Such a change in its outlook would naturally result in multiple rate cuts in 2024. Tom Lee, the analyst who in January 2023 unveiled an accurate S&P 500 target, recently said the ‚ÄúFed just wants to keep the business cycle happy and that gives them room to cut rates [in 2024].‚Äù In past columns, I‚Äôve stated the central bank wants to help President Joe Biden get reelected, so I could not agree with Lee‚Äôs statement more. The Housing Storm Cloud On Dec. 28, housing analyst Meredith Whitney, who correctly predicted the 2008 stock crash, [articulated a similar theory](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/home-prices-fall-silver-tsunami-050749678.html) about the housing sector as I did in a previous column. Specifically, Whitney, who was one of those who warned about the 2008 stock crash before it happened, believes lower interest rates will cause many Baby Boomers to sell their homes and buy smaller houses. As a result, Whitney, like me, expects housing prices to fall meaningfully. It‚Äôs unclear if Whitney expects this phenomenon to start in 2024. However, I think it will begin in the second or third quarter of next year. Still, given the strength of other areas of the economy and the lack of the same huge investments by large banks in housing in 2007, I don‚Äôt expect the decrease in housing prices to derail the economic expansion. On the date of publication, Larry Ramer did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com [Publishing Guidelines.](https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/)
